üá≤üáΩ $MELI in Mexico: The Doom Narrative vs. The Data

There is a growing narrative that MercadoLibre is facing structural fragility in Mexico due to FX volatility, rate pressure, and competition.

The data through Q3 2025 suggests the exact opposite: We are witnessing a decisive "turning of the corner" from expansion to ecosystem dominance.

Here is my objective (I tried to be at least üòÇ) breakdown of the Mexican operation as of late 2025.üëá

1Ô∏è‚É£ THE GROWTH ENGINE IS NOT SLOWING 
Despite the Super Peso unwind and macro headwinds, the top line is compounding relentlessly. 
‚Ä¢ GMV in Mexico accelerated to 36% FX-neutral growth in Q3. 
‚Ä¢ The thesis that FX volatility would crush purchasing power looks to be invalidated. Demand is inelastic to currency drags because the value prop (speed + credit) is superior.

2Ô∏è‚É£ LOGISTICS: THE STRUCTURAL MOAT 
The $AMZN & $PDD's Temu Threat ignores the physical reality of MELI's infrastructure. 
‚Ä¢ Unit Shipping Costs in Mexico: DOWN >12% YoY in Q3 '25. 
‚Ä¢ The Holy Grail of logistics: Costs are falling while volume scales. 
‚Ä¢ Strategic Unlock: The Texas Fulfillment Center is effectively nearshoring US inventory. While Asian competitors rely on trans-Pacific shipping (weeks), MELI moves US inventory to Mexican doorsteps in days. 
‚Ä¢ Speed: 80% of goods delivered within 48 hours. This kills the price-only utility of cross-border players for high-frequency needs.

3Ô∏è‚É£ FINTECH: SCALING WITH DISCIPLINE 
The bear case fears unchecked credit risk. The reality is algorithmic maturity. 
‚Ä¢ Credit Portfolio: has been growing rapidly. 
‚Ä¢ Asset Quality: 15-90 day NPLs have stabilized <7% (6.8% in Q3 '25). 
‚Ä¢ They are aggressively pursuing a Banking License in Mexico to capture payroll deposits (portability). 
‚Ä¢ This is the shift to Principality. They are moving from a payment processor to the primary bank account, lowering funding costs permanently.

4Ô∏è‚É£ THE MARGIN PROBLEM IS AN INVESTMENT 
Margins compressed to 9.8% (EBIT) in Q3 '25. 
Panic? No, because context matters. 
‚Ä¢ The compression is largely due to CECL upfront provisioning for the massive credit expansion (+83% portfolio growth). 
‚Ä¢ This is accounting friction, not an operational failure. You take the hit now to own the customer LTV for the next decade. 
‚Ä¢ OpEx Leverage: Product Development and G&A are actually scaling down as a % of revenue. The core machine is getting more efficient.

5Ô∏è‚É£ REGIONAL HEGEMON 
MercadoLibre in Mexico is actively decoupling from macro cyclicality. 
‚Ä¢ It has successfully segmented the market: Low-urgency cheap goods go to Asia while high-urgency, high-trust commerce stays on MELI. 
‚Ä¢ The Yellow rebranding and Meli+ ecosystem have created a closed-loop trap that is incredibly expensive for competitors to break.

$MELI isn't doomed in Mexico. It is effectively finalizing the construction of the country's retail and financial operating system.
